result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Gawlitta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, plus all other applicable costs, surcharges and assessments.  DOC to collect from 25% of prison funds. Any balance to convert to civil judgment upon release from Extended supervision.  Bail to apply.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.  Vocational/educational training.
Mental health assessment. Comply with recommended treatment. Take prescribed medications.

No drugs.  No contact with drug community.
No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 16 without agent's consent, with the exception of his children.
'No contact with F.S., L.P. or their families.
No electronic communications with children under the age of 16 without agent's approval.

Cognitive behavior therapy.
Sexual evaluation. Comply with  recommended treatment.
Pay supervision fees.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearm and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 11/24/14. LJ
Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (50 pages) commencing NOVEMBER 17, 2014 received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded.   Statements by state, defense and defendant.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS  concurrent with 2014CF1713, with credit for 30 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Mental health assesment  and comply with recommended treatment.
*Take prescribed mediations.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Sexual evaluation and comply with recommended treatment
*Vocational/educational training
*No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 16 without agent's consent, with the exception of his children. 
*Pay supervision fees
*No contact with FS, LP or their families
*No electronic commjunications with children under the age of 16 without agent's approval. 

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surchages.

Court ordered defendant to pay DNA surcharge plus of all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release from extended supervision.  Bail to be applied.  Balance of cash bail, if any, ordered returned to party who posted.  

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearm and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Filed,
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Justice Point pretrial report filed.  cg

Filed, JusticePoint Pretrial Report.
jad

Defendant Michael A Gawlitta in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:
State's motion to dismiss and read-in counts 2 and 3 granted by the court.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report.
jad

Defendant Michael A Gawlitta in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing on defendant's motion to suppress search proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County Sheriff Department Detective Dickson Woo.  Exhibits 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 offered and received into evidence.  Arguments made by counsel.  Defendant's motion to suppress search denied by the court.  Exhibit 2 withdrawn.  Exhibit list received and filed.  Case remains calendared on 10-2-2014 at 8:30 a.m. for final pretrial in Branch 10.

Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dugan, Br. 10 in room 423 of the safety building.    Case is adjourned to Br 10.  Status conference scheduled for 06-26-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Letter on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court ordered the defendant have NO CONTACT with his own children or any child under the age of 16.

Defendant Michael A Gawlitta in court with attorney David P Geraghty.  Defendant Michael A Gawlitta in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski presiding.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.   Arraignment scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney David P Geraghty in court, defendant Michael A Gawlitta not in court, in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Geraghty has been retained by defendant's family and is withdrawing indigency hearing request.
Case is adjourned to 4-21-2014 at 1:30pm for preliminary hearing.
Indigency hearing scheduled for 04-14-2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Defendant Michael A Gawlitta in court with Attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas, appearing as a friend of the court.  Defendant Michael A Gawlitta in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel informs Court that the Public Defender's office determined defendant was not eligible due to real estate ownership.  
Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing in Branch 12.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with FTS (girl in Texas) and her family, including mother Ginger F., Lacee (girl in Mississippi).
Absolutley not contact with the internet / no contact with children under sixteen years of age except defendant's own children.

Defendant Michael A Gawlitta in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant Michael A Gawlitta in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
